definition[0]: to find out exactly where something is
example[0]: A mechanic is trying to localize the fault.
definition[1]: to limit the effect that something has, or the size of area it covers
example[1]: They hoped to localize the fighting.
definition[2]: to organize a business or industry so that things happen at a local level rather than a national one
example[2]: The company is continuing with its efforts to localize production.
definition[3]: to make changes in advertising etc to make it more suitable for a particular place
example[3]: the free weeklies in Los Angeles that localize news and advertising
